author: andschwa
body:
- [x] Resolves #1309.
- [x] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [x] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

First go at implementing the side-by-side Unix package design detailed [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1309#issuecomment-237390207). I've tested and it's working. I still need to update a bunch of documentation regarding this, but wanted a review.

Please take a look and test @raghushantha.

comments.author: raghushantha
comments.body:
@andschwa Can you include license.txt as part of the package?

@joeyaiello Do we need to include ThirdPartyNotices.txt in the package?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @raghushantha Per 4eea68f the license is included in every copy of the build (and so included int he package).

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
License needs to be in the repo, in the EULA in the MSI installer, and in the root of every package. Binary dependencies need to be in the MSI installer, and the root of every package. Third party notices (the ones applicable to source code) need to be in the root of the repository. 

Make sense?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @joeyaiello for binary dependencies, can you give me a document for that?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @andschwa we don't have it yet. When I do, you guys will be the first to know

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: No worries. @raghushantha, @joeyaiello can I get a sign off?
